  • Constructor Details

    • ExceptionUtil

      public ExceptionUtil()

  • Method Details

    • findExceptionCause

      public static Throwable findExceptionCause(Throwable e)
      Given an Exception, finds the root cause and returns it. This may end up returning the originally passed exception if that was the root cause.
      Parameters:
      e - the Throwable whose root cause should be located.
      Returns:
      the root Throwable, or e if it is the root.

    • findExceptionCause

      public static Throwable findExceptionCause(Throwable e, Class<?>[] stopTypes)
      Given an Exception, finds the root cause and returns it. This may end up returning the originally passed exception if that was the root cause. If it encounters an exception that matches one of the stopTypes, it will return that exception
      Parameters:
      e - the Throwable whose root cause should be located.
      stopTypes - set of exceptions, if the cause matches one of these exceptions, the cause will be returned.
      Returns:
      the root Throwable, or e if it is the root.

    • getCallerMethod

      public static String getCallerMethod(int skip, int level)
      This will report the caller method names, if you don't want the current routine in the list skip should be 1. If want more than one level up, level should be greater than 1. So to get the functionality implied by the name use (1,1) as your arguments. WARNING this is costly and should only be used in predicated debug statements. 
      
    if (PLLoggerCategory.PLUGIN.DebugEnabled) {
      PLLoggerCategory.PLUGIN.debug(ExceptionUtil.getCallerMethod(0,1))
    }
      Parameters:
      skip - the number of callers
      level - how far to unwind
      Returns:
      a comma separated string.

    • getFilteredCaller

      public static String getFilteredCaller(int skip, int depth)
      This will report the caller method names, if you don't want the current routine in the list skip should be 1. If want more than one level up, level should be greater than 1. So to get the functionality implied by the name use (1,1) as your arguments. WARNING this is costly and should only be used in predicated debug statements. 
      
    if (PLLoggerCategory.PLUGIN.DebugEnabled) {
      PLLoggerCategory.PLUGIN.debug(ExceptionUtil.getFilteredCaller(0,3))
    }
      Parameters:
      skip - the number of callers
      depth - how far to unwind
      Returns:
      a comma separated string.

    • getFilterStackTrace

      @NotNull public static @NotNull ArrayList<StackTraceElement> getFilterStackTrace(int skip, int depth)
      This will report the stacktrace elements, if you don't want the current routine in the list skip should be 1. If want more than one level up, level should be greater than 1. So to get the functionality implied by the name use (1,1) as your arguments. WARNING this is costly and should only be used in debug/test/error instances.
      Parameters:
      skip - the number of callers
      depth - how far to unwind
      Returns:
      a comma separated string.

    • unwrapException

      public static Throwable unwrapException(Throwable e)
      Given an Exception, finds the real cause. This will remove WrappedException subclasses and RuntimeException. This may end up returning the originally passed exception if that was the root cause.
      Parameters:
      e - the Throwable whose root cause should be located.
      Returns:
      the root Throwable, or e if it is the root.

    • convertToRuntimeException

      public static RuntimeException convertToRuntimeException(Throwable t)
      Deprecated.
      Does not handle Errors properly. Use throwUnchecked(Throwable) instead.
      Given any throwable exception convert to a runtime exception. If the throwable is a runtime then simply throw it, otherwise wrap it in a runtime.
      Parameters:
      t - Throwable to convert to a run-time
      Returns:
      Runtime exception

    • convertToRuntimeException

      public static RuntimeException convertToRuntimeException(Exception e)
      Converts the given Exception to a RuntimeException.
      Parameters:
      e - exception to convert
      Returns:
      the given exception, if it is a RuntimeException. Otherwise, returns a new RuntimeException with the given exception as its cause.

    • throwUnchecked

      public static void throwUnchecked(Throwable t)
      Throws the given Throwable as an unchecked exception. If the given throwable is either an Error or RuntimeException, then it is simply thrown. Otherwise, a RuntimeException is thrown with the given throwable as its cause.

      This method will always terminate abnormally (i.e., by throwing something), but the compiler doesn't know that. So in some situations you may need to help it out by adding a throw after the call to this method. For example, the following will not compile, though it is semantically legal: 

       public int foo() {
   try {
     return calculateLength();
   } catch (Throwable t) {
     ExceptionUtil.throwUnchecked(t);
   }
 }
      The compiler will complain that not all paths return a value (missing return statement). To fix this, you could change the above code to the following: 
       public int foo() {
   try {
     return calculateLength();
   } catch (Throwable t) {
     ExceptionUtil.throwUnchecked(t);
     throw new AssertionError();
   }
 }

    • findExceptionTypeOrCause

      public static Throwable findExceptionTypeOrCause(Class<?> exceptionStopType, Throwable t)
      Given an Exception and an exception stop class, finds the root cause and returns it. This may end up returning the originally passed exception if that was the root cause. One use case is to find a "user displayable" exception in the stack.
      Parameters:
      exceptionStopType - An exception class that will be returned if found in the cause stack.
      t - The Throwable whose root cause should be located.
      Returns:
      The root Throwable, or e if it is the root.

    • findExceptionOfTypeInCausalityChain

      public static <T extends Throwable> T findExceptionOfTypeInCausalityChain(Class<T> exceptionTypeToFind, Throwable t)
      Given an Exception and an Exception type to look for, finds the exception of that type or returns null if none of that type exist.

    • getStackTrace

      public static String getStackTrace(Throwable t)
      Returns the stack trace of the Throwable as a String.
      Parameters:
      t - the Throwable whose stack trace should be returned.
      Returns:
      the stack trace of the Throwable as a String.

    • getCompleteStackTrace

      public static String getCompleteStackTrace(Throwable t)
      Gets the full stack trace (including long causal chains) Won't explode if the causal chain contains a loop (getStackTrace will)
      Parameters:
      t - the top of the causal chain
      Returns:
      complete causal stack trace chain, broken on loop

    • getCausesStrings

      public static List<String> getCausesStrings(Throwable exception)
      This will reduce the stack trace to a list of strings, one for each exception in the cause status
      Parameters:
      exception - the exception to start at
      Returns:
      the list of strings

    • printXMLParseExceptionDetails

      public static void printXMLParseExceptionDetails(Throwable throwable, String filename)

    • writeAllStackDump

      public static void writeAllStackDump(Appendable writer, int depth)
      This will write the stack trace out for all threads, down to a specified depth.
      Parameters:
      writer - the appender to append to
      depth - the depth to ascend to (0 for all)

    • getStackTraceAsList

      public static List<String> getStackTraceAsList(Throwable t)
